overview:
This class allows you interact with Error Reporting.

First, install @google-cloud/error-reporting with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/error-reporting

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/error-reportingâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var errors = require('@google-cloud/error-reporting')();

Elsewhere

var errors = require('@google-cloud/error-reporting')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/error-reporting are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: buildStackTrace
methods.description: Constructs a string representation of the stack trace at the point where this function was invoked. Note that the stack trace will not include any references to frames specific to this error-reporting library itself.

params.name: message
params.description: • The message that should appear as the first line of the stack trace. This value defaults to the empty string.
